title: Radio station letterheads and QSL cards of the 1920s and 30s.
content:
This may be of interest. It certainly is to a "radio guy" like myself. Enjoy!

[http://uv201.com/Misc\_Pages/letterheads\_1.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022082109/http:/uv201.com/Misc_Pages/letterheads_1.htm "http://uv201.com/Misc\_Pages/letterheads\_1.htm")
author: ivandurakov

comments.content:
wow... takes me back to my naff QSL card back in the 80's - nothing like as nice as some of those.

G1KAD

I think this guy would appreciate them!:

[http://pitchfork.tv/?p=one-week-only](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022082109/http:/pitchfork.tv/?p=one-week-only)

78 collector Joe Bussard. The video link is only up for a few more days but it looks as if the full film is commercially available. The music is great but I'd love to just pore over the labels for hours!

Is that Garage Gothic used for the occasional subtitles?

There are clips on YouTube too.

[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q5skAQvJ4RQ](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022082109/http:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q5skAQvJ4RQ)

I really want to get this on DVD but it looks like I have to wait until December for the UK release.
